metaDescriptions.default: Ryan Daley (RP Daley) is a Software Developer at Shopify who resides in Toronto, Canada.
metaDescriptions./about/: Information about Ryan Daley (RP Daley) including Employment, Eductaion, and Courses
metaDescriptions./uses/: Non-exhaustive page of items that I use for development including Hardware, Software, Accessories, and Furnature

description.title: Web Development Bootcamp
info: - Diploma: Web Development

description.title: Bachelor of Computer Science
info: - Degree: Integrated Computer Science

description.title: Bachelor of Science (Honours)
info: - Degree: Biology

description.title: Software Developer
info: - Working on the Core - Optimize Team

description.title: Software Developer
info: - Currently the developer for the Chromecast Receiver for all Bell Media brands
- Previous responsibilities included creating the web authentication for TSN & RDS direct to consumer (D2C), and maintaining the CraveTV property for web.
- Technologies: JavaScript, AJAX, JSON, HTML, CSS, npm, node.js, JIRA, git, Charles Proxy, Akamai Identity Services (AIS), CSG Ascendon, JWT.

description.title: Full-Stack Developer
info: - Supported CraveTV and web authentication.
- Responsibilities included integration and deployment of builds / web components to various server environments, and assisting external development agencies integrate services and platforms.
- Technologies: JavaScript, AJAX, JSON, HTML, CSS, node.js, JIRA, git, Charles Proxy.

description.title: Automation Engineer - In-Car Experience
info: - Designed, implemented, and maintained an automated test system to validate daily iOS builds for CarPlay.
- Designed, implemented, and maintained a system to manage software quality issue reports and alert all stakeholders in a daily email report.
- Technologies: Python, Ruby, UIA2 (JavaScript), shell scripting, HTML, CSS.

description.title: Software QA Engineer - Accessories QA
info: - Tested iPod / iPhone / iPad integration (wired and wireless) with car stereos.
- Responsible for writing test plans, executing tests, regressing, isolating and reporting issues found during testing.

description.title: QA Analyst
info: - Represented QA and testing in all aspects of the Agile Scrum development process including Sprint Planning and daily Scrum meetings.
- Created and executed test plans and test cases (manual and automated) for user stories, including risk based regression testing.
- Technologies: shell scripting, Jira, GreenHopper, Pivotal Tracker.

description.title: UBC Campus Ambassador
info: - Acted as the liaison between the University of British Columbia and Research In Motion.
- Responsible for assisting the Campus Recruitment team from RIM find and recruit potential candidates for their new graduate and co-op positions.
- Aided candidates with their applications to RIM, prepare for their interviews, and their successful transition from UBC to RIM.

description.title: Software Test Associate - New Product Testing (Co-op)
info: - Executed testing of new software on both production and prototype BlackBerry Wireless Handhelds.
- Responsible for performing various types of tests including integration, regression, performance and general smoke tests.
- Position demonstrated my ability to be a flexible team player who excels in an environment that requires the ability to effectively prioritize and juggle multiple concurrent projects.

description.title: Fullstack Advanced React and GraphQL
info: - Created by: Wes Bos
- Training Course using React.js, Next.js, GraphQL, Node.js, Apollo, and Keystone

description.title: SCS 3253 - Machine Learning
info: - Instructor: Michael Ciniello

description.title: DSN 102 - Design Execution: Bringing Ideas to Life
info: - Instructor: Peter Macdonald

description.title: DSN 101 - Ideation: The History and Theory of Design
info: - Instructor: Barry Katz

items.itemDescription: This is my current editor. I'm a recent convert from Sublime Text which I had been using for nearly five years.
I don't do much image manipulation, but when I do GIMP is what I use.
Sometimes it's nice to visulize what is happening in a complex git project. Started using Tower at one of my previous jobs, and now I swear by it.
I use both Google Chrome, and Apple Safari, but I find that Chrome has more / better extensions for development, and more developer support.
Similar to Tower, FileZilla isn't required... but it is definiatly nice to sometimes visulize file structures when transfering / deploying code.
Pretty sure everyone who does anything involviong APIs uses Postman. Testing / developing backend services, and developing / validating frontend responses is much easier with Postman
I use Charles to intecept / modify requests and responses for API testing / development.
This is my main personal computer. It's a little old, but it's not currently limiting development in any way... so we continue on!
I have a couple of these around the house. I use them as HTPCs, hosts for local services, etc.
iPhone best fits my needs. Use the best tools for you.
I am currently using two of these as my development monitors. They are big and clean, so I am able to keep everything needed open and visible
My audio interface that is no longer made... turns my KRK monitors into Desktop speakers, and allows me to easily connect and control headphones / microphones.

I have a love-hate relationship with Logitech mice... when they work, they are the best, but they sometimes go rogue - randomly disconnect, jitter when they aren't being touched, scrolling stops working until I re-pair it... but this is my favourite mouse, and I'll replace it with the same one if it breaks / dissappears.
This is task dependant... sometimes this trackpad feels more 'right' when doing development than the MX Master. I have no idea why.
I have a couple of these with random backups of projects, photos, and media. They are fast and small...
Studio monitors that I use as desktop speakers. Apparently there has been 2 generations since mine were made... mine are blue.
I custom made this keyboard. I made it pretty ugly... on purpose. (It has the letters of my name in lime green, and the spacebar has a picture of a spaceship on it.)
This is a hub that I use to connect wired Internet, and USB-A devices to my laptop.
When I first started working at Apple, I couldn't see the use case for tablets... I use this mostly as a bed / couch / patio Internet / email / media device.

I have a ton of headphones / earphones. Current ones on / attached to my desk: AirPods Pro, Shure SE846, V-MODA Crossfade M-80 (with BoomPro Microphone), Audio-Technica BPHS1, and Sony WH-1000XM3. I rotate them depending on the task / comfort...

I have a ton of headphones / earphones. Current ones on / attached to my desk: AirPods Pro, Shure SE846, V-MODA Crossfade M-80 (with BoomPro Microphone), Audio-Technica BPHS1, and Sony WH-1000XM3. I rotate them depending on the task / comfort...

Older black and white laser printer
Photo printer... it prints up to 11x17.
